alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 10:18PM EDT until September 09 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lackawanna, Luzerne and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. Water rescues are occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1018 PM EDT, Radar indicated heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Rainfall will continue to taper off. Additional rainfall amounts less than 1 inch are expected over the area. Additional flooding is not expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scranton, Pittston, Waverly, Dunmore, Old Forge, Archbald, Dickson City, Moosic, Olyphant, Clarks Summit, Edwardsville, Luzerne, Harveys Lake, West Wyoming, Clarks Green, Dalton, La Plume, Glendale, Wallsville and Fleetville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
